ygData.subject: Re: Wicked Blades in the Dark!!
ygData.msgSnippet: Straight Shot sighs in relief as well.  She was happy to see that the bleeding could at least be slowed down enough to bide Tucson time to get back to the Ark.

Straight Shot sighs in relief as well.  She was happy to see that the bleed=
ing could at least be slowed down enough to bide Tucson time to get back to=
 the Ark.  Rat Trap finishes what he can and re enters the cab in beast mod=
e.

"Well, that's it for now, the lines are temporarilly taped up, no more =
fluid leaks, but that tape only lasts so long before it deteriorates.  I'd =
say we got a good twelve hours at best."

Tucson replies.

"Thank you Rat T=
rap.  That - should be enough time to get us all back to the Ark."

Night S=
hift tries to give a status report to Lord Elder, but finds he is not getti=
ng through.

"Oh scrap, guys, I can't communicate with the Ark, somethn's w=
rong."

Straight Shot looks out the window, and down to Night Shift.

" No =
way.  Maybe it's just some interference.  Lemme see if I can patch through.=
"

She tries, same result.

" Oh scrap, Tucson, Talon, guys, he's right.  I=
 can't patch through either.  All I'm getting is static.  Not good."

Tucso=
n growls.

" It may not be as simple as interference.  Someone is blocking =
our reception.  The same entity that is interfering with the Ark's function=
ability. "

Night Shift grumbles.

"Legacy!"

Tucson replies.

"No, I thoug=
ht that too at first, but it isn't him.  He would have harmed us by now if =
it was. We're dealing with another enemy, and as soon as we find out who it=
 is, they'll be dealt with appropriately and quickly."

Night Shift continu=
es to help pull Tucson home.

"So, how'dya propose ta do that?"

Tucson sig=
hs.

" My concern is everyone's well being.  And this entity has violated t=
hat.  And that kind of voilation in my book is not to be tolerated.  Truthf=
ully it infuriates me to think that someone could attack one's primary vuln=
erability in such a thoughtless manner.  And if that is the way they wish t=
o play the game, then in this case, I can play the same game too.  They wan=
t rough, I won't spare them any details.  And honestly, I am not going to h=
old back my temper on them, if they so chose to try me."

Rat Trap watches =
Tucson's vitals.

"Hey, easy, Wheels, you're gonna overheat if ya keep that=
 up.  But, it's about time those creeps got a serious beat up job.  Those c=
reepoids have been bringn' us down for a long time, and once, just once I w=
anna see them get what they really deserve."

Straight Shot nodds.

"Yeah, =
it's about time they got payback.  Look what they did ta Nightlight, Windlo=
rd, Rodimus, and Perceptor.  It wasn't fair, and it's still not fair.  And =
because of Hydras, he's tarnished so many good reputations, it's enough ta =
make any bot go ill!"

Night Shift listens in on the conversation.

" Yeah,=
 well, as soon as this big guy's repaired and on duty, those creeps are gon=
na wish that Optimus Prime finished them off before they got ta live this l=
ong.  I know Tucson, you do NOT wanna get on his bad side, not now not ever=
.  I've seen what he's capable of, turned some cons inta scrap vorns ago, t=
ill ya couldn't recognize who they were anymore. That was before he became =
a Prime, in rookie years."

Straight Shot grins.

"I remember that.  Talon,=
 if you saw Tucson back then, you'd be jumping for joy, because in the old =
days, he didn't think twice about turning a con inta scrap.  It was really =
fun ta watch 'em pull them apart literally.  After that, only the really st=
rong cons would try ta go up against him."

Tucson responds.

" Oh, those d=
ays may not be over yet, Straight Shot.  I will lay harm on those who have =
laid harm on all of you, I give you that promise. Rat Trap, part of my ener=
gy is coming back, where are my guages now?"

Rat Trap reads it.

"Yep, six=
ty percent, not wonderful but enough ta drive on."

Tucson now contacts Tor=
ca and Noctorro.

"Noctorro, Torca, I've regained sixty percent of my energ=
y reserve.  It should be enough for me to drive on my own now.  I thank you=
 deeply for your assistance, and wish not to burden you any further.  After=
 all, towing a vehicle my size and weight, must put quite a strain on your =
systems.  I'd rather not see that happen."

Night Shift continues to towe.
=

"You sure about that big guy?"

Tucson turns his engine back on and puts h=
imself in drive Yet he remains still.

"Yes, I'm sure.  Please, don't strai=
n yourselves on my account. I will take it slow, I promise. Night Shift, No=
ctorro, I need you two to go ahead of me, and get to the Ark as quickly as =
you can.  Torca, I will need you to bring up their flank. I will follow beh=
ind with Talon, Windlord, Rat Trap and Straight Shot.  The Ark is in peril,=
 and that is where the bulk of our forces is needed now."

Night Shift rele=
ases his harnesses.

"Yes sir, I'm on it."

He waits for Noctorro to advanc=
e along with him.
